#StarSchemas is a way to organize data for performant queries. In this video, we'll look at the essence of a start schema, then look at how one can be implemented using Data Factory pipelines, data flows, and a #DataLake.

https://youtu.be/_SxpkmwXtvo

#Azure #DataFactory is tool for performing #ETL processes. The designer easily orchestrates data movement and transforms. In this video, we look at the nuts and bolts of an ETL process and build on a data movement process.

https://youtu.be/oPj7T9cBD0o

Many services though have adopted integration with Azure AD and IAM controls on Azure that enable users to authenticate against Azure and then access resources directly from a browser without needing a backend server using #MSAL.

https://youtu.be/U-uEv2b0mRU

Azure is a Gaming Platform! You can install games on a #GPU enabled #VirtualMachine and use your remote PC to play the game.

https://youtu.be/_UrzJBp7Vsw

#Jekyll layouts can be customized using #Liquid, a simple, easy to use inline language that allows you to add some programmability to your website. 

https://youtu.be/Q--pC-gqaKM

#JAMStack stands for #JavaScript, #API's and #Markup, and is an architectural pattern for building web-based applications. #Azure provides services for hosting applications that deploy the pattern. 

https://youtu.be/A7S0iWnhz1M

Jekyll is a great tool for generating static websites from simple markdown files. GitHub's has built-in support for Jekyll-based sites. Lean to set up a Jekyll repo on GitHub, and publish the results to FREE hosting on Azure.

https://youtu.be/kyd36GgtB5A

#Azure #StaticWebApps provide an easy and robust way to host static apps an content, and they integrate easily with #GitHub. In this video, we'll look at this option and spin up a quick site using GitHub and Azure.

https://youtu.be/ULr3XzkN4e0

With Azure, there are options that allow you create websites and even dynamically update them with code for less than you might think. Get periodic updates from a data source using Azure Functions. All for less than $.25/mo!

https://youtu.be/lTBtF3e9Lxk

In the webinar, we’ll look at both #HotPath and #ColdPath data services on #Azure services like #EventHubs, #ServiceBus, #DataLakes, #DataFactory, #StreamAnalytics, and #AzureSQL and how they work for data flows.

https://youtu.be/cLGZGzkOeuc

An object #graph is a great way to represent relationships between people, places, and things. In this #video, we look at the technologies on #Azure #CosmosDB for creating and querying graphs through the #Gremlin query language.

https://youtu.be/98PtbE4f4B8

Refactoring can be very simple to very complex depending on the application and the target environment. There are three different approaches for migrating as-is, migrating with minor refactoring, and migration as a major rewrite.

https://youtu.be/StwfY65en9w

https://youtu.be/iVcQGpILFTc

PaaS as a service can be the most economical and efficient way to to build applications for the cloud. We'll look at a refactored monolith application into a cloud native application hosted on Azure.

https://youtu.be/l27VqLKvvXc

Migration into #Azure can take one of many a path forward. Three different approaches: lift and shift to Azure #IaaS, #Containers, then finally app modernization through refactoring to run on #PaaS.

https://youtu.be/26oNvlE8Vqg

An #Azure #LandingZone is your first step into Azure. With a landing zone, you define many of the necessary things to operate an Azure environment. We'll look at these considerations setting up #Azure #LandingZones.

https://youtu.be/26oNvlE8Vqg

As organizations grow with #Azure adoptions, so do the number of subscriptions. In this video, we'll look at how to use #ManagementGroups for creating hierarchies and managing #RBAC across those groups.

https://youtu.be/dn7I38EU1ZI

https://youtu.be/zGHOa-rw41Y

#Kusto Query Language (#KQL) is the backbone #LogAnalytics, #Sentinel, #AzureDataExplorer. It is an essential skill for #SecOps persons who want to take full advantage of Microsoft security products on Azure.
